column5: No report to make so I will add a contribution because I care   http://www.coldwaterbootcamp.com/

We used to go jetty jumping on the East coast as part of our training. Quite a shock when you hit the water, and I was used to it.  2 minutes of immersion in the Labrador current is enough to kill a man. We grew up with having winter saunas . Even with that kind of conditioning it doesn't take much before hypothermia sets in.
Very good link!!!  I especially like this vid: http://www.coldwaterbootcamp.com/flash/Gord_demo.swf

Thanks for the link! Very important knowledge for this time of year. Wearing a lifejacket is obviously key, but breathing properly seems real important as well. Seems like being overweight might actually be beneficial in cold water.
